search_results.snippet: Cyrus Roberts Vance (March 27, 1917  January 12, 2002) was an American lawyer and United States Secretary of State under President Jimmy Carter from 1977 to 1980. Prior to that position he was the Secretary of the Army and the Deputy Secretary of Defense.
search_results.title: Cyrus Vance - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: Cyrus Roberts Vance was appointed Secretary of State by President Jimmy Carter on January 21, 1977. He entered his position on January 23 and resigned on April 28, 1980 in protest over President Carter's decision to attempt a military rescue of American hostages in Iran.
